intro: Barbosella reichenbachiana, commonly known as the Reichenbach's barbosella, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, mountainous environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
